newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Venezuela tanker refloated, but restriction stays.
newsitem.headline: Venezuela tanker refloated, but restriction stays.

text.p: The Olympic Sponsor oil tanker, which went aground in Venezuela's Lake Maracaibo shipping channel on March 10, was refloated on Thursday, but a draught restriction remains in force in the channel, shipping sources said.
"The Sponsor was refloated at 1158 (am, local time)...but the draught restriction is still in effect. We haven't heard anything from the port captain," the source said.

A source at Petroleos de Venezuela said previously that the 36-foot draught restriction, down from a normal 39.5 feet, had resulted in about a five percent drop in the one million barrels per day of oil exports from Lake Maracaibo.

Shipping inspectors say that continuing heavy swell in the channel is preventing a sonar survey of the channel floor. The inspectors are trying to find out why two oil tankers grounded at the same spot in the channel within two weeks, one causing an oil spill of at least 25,000 barrels.
